intro: Baeria macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered baeria, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its showy, yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green bracts, making it visually distinctive. Baeria macrantha is often found in coastal and inland regions, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
